excerpt: Long, spacious beach with an upbeat vibe featuring nearby resorts, restaurants & shopping.
detail_description: Chaweng Beach is a vibrant and expansive stretch of sand that captures the essence of Koh Samui's lively atmosphere. This popular destination attracts visitors from around the world, offering an array of nearby resorts, restaurants, and shopping options. With its bustling nightlife and a market that spans three kilometers, Chaweng Beach is perfect for those looking to indulge in retail therapy or savor delicious local cuisine. Whether you're on the hunt for trendy swimwear or unique souvenirs, you'll find it all here.
name: Chaweng Beach
address: Surat Thani, Thailand

excerpt: Massive, circa-1972 gilded Buddha statue at the colorful Phra Yai temple complex.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Bo Put district of Koh Samui, the Big Buddha Temple (Wat Phra Yai) is home to a stunning gilded statue that dates back to 1972. This iconic landmark not only draws visitors for its spiritual significance but also for its picturesque surroundings. The nearby beach offers a delightful mix of low- to mid-cost bungalows, many featuring excellent dining options and luxurious spas.
name: Big Buddha Temple (Wat Phra Yai)
address: Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Fisherman's Village Night Market is a vibrant hub of culinary delights and local culture, perfect for those looking to indulge in an authentic experience. As the sun sets, the market comes alive with stalls offering a variety of delicious street food that showcases the region's flavors. From fresh seafood to tantalizing desserts, there's something for every palate. The lively atmosphere is enhanced by local artisans showcasing their crafts, making it not just a place to eat but also to shop and soak in the unique ambiance.
name: Fisherman's Village Night Market
address: H25J+9HJ, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: Tranquil, colorful temple complex featuring a lake with an 18-armed statue of the goddess Guanyin.
detail_description: Nestled on the northeastern coast of Koh Samui, Wat Plai Laem is a mesmerizing temple complex that captivates visitors with its vibrant colors and serene atmosphere. The highlight here is the stunning 18-armed statue of Guanyin, the goddess of mercy and compassion, which gracefully rises above a tranquil lake. This remarkable site beautifully showcases the blend of Thai culture with Chinese heritage, making it an essential stop for anyone exploring the island.
name: Wat Plai Laem
address: 4171, Thailand, Amphoe Ko Samui, Chang Wat Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: White-sand beach lined with bars & restaurants, with rentable lounge chairs & palm trees.
detail_description: Lamai Beach, located on the picturesque southeast coast of Koh Samui, is a tropical paradise that perfectly blends relaxation and adventure. This stunning stretch of white sand is adorned with swaying palm trees and lined with an array of bars and restaurants, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing or enjoying a refreshing drink. Visitors can rent lounge chairs to soak up the sun while taking in the breathtaking jade-green waters that are safe for swimming along most parts of the beach.
name: Lamai Beach
address: Surat Thani, Thailand

excerpt: Modest beach featuring Fisherman's Village, which offers shops, restaurants, diving & more.
detail_description: Bo Phut Beach, located in the north of Koh Samui, is a modest yet charming destination that offers a mix of natural beauty and cultural experiences. The beach is divided into two sections: Bophut Beach itself and the renowned Fisherman's Village. This village is known for its well-preserved elegance, with wooden Chinese shop-houses blending seamlessly with modern buildings to create a Mediterranean atmosphere. It was once the main French outpost on the island.
name: Bo Phut Beach
address: Surat Thani, Thailand

excerpt: Home for rescued elephants featuring a pool, feeding sessions & walks with the residents.
detail_description: Nestled in Bophut, the Samui Elephant Sanctuary offers a heartwarming experience for animal lovers and travelers alike. This sanctuary is dedicated to rescuing elephants and providing them with a safe haven where they can roam freely without the burden of riding or forced interactions. Inspired by the Save Elephant Foundation, it stands as a beacon of ethical tourism on the island, allowing visitors to engage with these gentle giants through feeding sessions and leisurely walks.
name: Samui Elephant Sanctuary Bophut
address: Samui Elephant Sanctuary, 108/52 Taweerat Pakdee Rd, Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Na Muang 2 Waterfall is situated in the southern part of Koh Samui's ring road and can be easily accessed by following a sign directing to the waterfall and Na Muang Safari Park. Visitors have the option to either take an off-road jeep from the safari park or follow the road up to reach the waterfall. It is part of a park that also houses Na Muang 1, known as the 'Purple Waterfalls.'
name: Na Mueang Waterfall 2
address: FXCR+W59, Tambon Na Mueang, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84140, Thailand

excerpt: Storied natural rock formations known for bearing a resemblance to male & female genitalia.
detail_description: Grandfather and Grandmother Rocks, also known as Hin Ta Hin Yai, are natural rock formations in Thailand that resemble male and female genitalia. Legend has it that they are named after an old couple who died at sea while traveling to arrange a marriage for their son. These unique formations have become a popular tourist attraction on Ko Samui, drawing visitors to the Fishermans Village along Bo Phut Beach.
name: Hin Ta Hin Yai
address: 92 84310, 126/92 Moo 3, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: One of the top beaches in Koh Samui is Silver Beach, also known as Crystal Beach or Thongtakian Beach. It's a favorite among tourists for its panoramic beauty and silver-colored rocks that make it perfect for photo sessions. The beach is just a short ride away from other beautiful beaches like Chaweng Noi, Coral Cove, Lipa Noi, and Choeng Mon. Koh Samui offers a variety of stunning beaches and fantastic experiences to make your visit worthwhile.
name: Silver Beach Stones
address: 1, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

excerpt: Laid-back beach, several kilometers long, backed with palm trees, rental bungalows & restaurants.
detail_description: Maenam Beach on Ko Samui is a laid-back, several kilometers long stretch of coastline lined with palm trees, rental bungalows, and restaurants. It faces north into the Gulf of Thailand from the island's north-central coast and offers deeper waters for adult swimmers compared to other beaches on the island. This beach provides a peaceful and serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for families with children looking to swim and sunbathe in shallow waters.
name: Maenam Beach
address: 2, Tambon Mae Nam, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84330, Thailand

detail_description: Coco Tam’s is a popular open-air beach bar situated on the picturesque Bophut Beach in Koh Samui, Thailand. It offers a relaxed tropical atmosphere with beanbags on the sand, swing seats at the bar, cabanas, and shisha. Visitors can enjoy chilled out tunes and stunning sunset views over the ocean while sipping on refreshing drinks.
name: Coco Tam’s
address: 62, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: This scenic island airport with tropical decor & gardens has a thatched roof & no walls.
detail_description: Samui Airport is a charming island airport with a tropical ambiance, featuring thatched roofs and open-air design. The airport boasts lush gardens and trees, creating a unique and pleasant setting reminiscent of a resort. Visitors can enjoy browsing through lovely shops offering local treats like Kalamare, while also having access to snacks, soft drinks, coffee, and water provided by Bangkok Airways. The service is commendable, making it feel like more than just an airport.
name: Samui Airport
address: 99, Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Perched on a hill near Chaweng Lake, the Chedi Wat Khao Hua Chuk is a stunning golden temple complex that offers breathtaking views of Koh Samui's coastline and valleys. The intricate carvings and golden sculptures of Lord Buddha inside the temple are truly captivating. Visitors can also receive blessings from monks and take home a bracelet for their journey.
name: Chedi Wat Khao Hua Chuk
address: G3P5+RGX, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Guan Yu Shrine on Koh Samui is a significant site dedicated to the Chinese deity Guan Yu, known as the god of war in Chinese mythology. The shrine features an imposing 16-meter high statue of Guan Yu, making it the largest bronze statue of him in Thailand. Visitors can explore this compact yet compelling attraction and enjoy nearby amenities such as parking, food and drink options. Situated near Lamai Beach, the shrine offers picturesque views and a pleasant atmosphere for relaxation.
name: GUAN YU KOH SAMUI SHRINE
address: 190 C2WF+3W8, 11 หมู่ 1 4169, Tambon Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: Bo Phut, situated in the northern part of Koh Samui between Big Buddha and Maenam, is a well-liked destination offering a balance between the liveliness of larger towns on the east coast and the peacefulness of the south and west coasts. The beach features a long, gently curving shoreline with clear blue waters creating a tranquil atmosphere. Most accommodations and amenities are concentrated at the eastern end near a seafront high street.
name: Bo Phut
address: Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Coral Cove Beach, located on the east coast of Koh Samui, is a serene and unspoiled slice of paradise. Despite its small size, this beach boasts reddish sand, turquoise waters, beautiful palm trees, and dramatic boulders that create a picturesque backdrop for relaxation, water activities, or photo shoots. It is considered one of the best beaches in the area for snorkeling.
name: Coral Cove Beach
address: F3R6+6GC, 4169, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

excerpt: This coastal stop offers panoramic seaside views & has a small shaded pavilion with seating.
detail_description: Lad Koh View Point is a must-visit coastal stop on the eastern coastline of Koh Samui. It offers stunning panoramic views of the island's mountains, beaches, and unique rocky features. The viewpoint features a small shaded pavilion with seating and a walking path along the coastline, making it an ideal spot to take a break and enjoy the beautiful roadside scenery. Additionally, visitors can explore Angthong, a 42-island group that forms Thailand's vast marine reserve.
name: Lad Koh View Point
address: F3X5+JX5, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Wat Samret, located near Th Ban Hua, is a serene temple showcasing remarkable Buddha statues and a forest of ancient stupas. The site features a rare solid marble Mandalay sitting Buddha, along with a tranquil long reclining Buddha surrounded by various Buddhist figures. Inside the temple's hall, visitors can explore over 80 intriguing Buddha images, including the prominent Reclining Buddha.
name: Wat Samret
address: C2Q6+HGH, Tambon Na Mueang, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84140, Thailand

detail_description: Central Samui, the largest shopping complex in Chaweng, is a must-visit destination for shopaholics. Divided into four sections - Fisherman Village, Bird Cage, Chaweng Port, and Beach Town Market - it offers a wide range of shopping options from clothing and accessories to international and Thai brands. The beautifully designed complex also features a refreshing terrace garden where you can relax after your shopping spree.
name: Central Samui
address: 209, 3 ตำบล บ่อผุด, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Island Organics Thai Cooking Class Koh Samui offers a unique experience on the island, where visitors can learn about the history of the business and explore the organic farm and aquaponic setup. The class is hosted by Chef Lat and her team at their idyllic farm property in the hills above Chaweng.
name: Island Organics Thai cooking Class Koh Samui
address: 24/1 Moo 4, Bangrak / Chaweng, ตำบล บ่อผุด Ko Samui District, 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Samui Elephant Sanctuary Chaweng Noi offers an incredible and private experience with rescued elephants. Visitors can independently arrive at the sanctuary, where they will be greeted by friendly and informative guides. The elephants are well cared for, healthy, and happy. The half-day visit includes a pick-up and drop-off service as well as a delicious lunch with vegetarian options. The sanctuary is thoughtfully designed to provide ample space for the elephants to roam freely.
name: Samui Elephant Sanctuary Chaweng Noi
address: Tambon Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: Located in Chaweng, Elephant Beach Club offers a relaxed atmosphere with beachfront seating and lounge chairs for unwinding by the sea. Guests can enjoy a mesmerizing fire dance performance while savoring their meals. The friendly and attentive staff provide excellent service, making it a recommended dining spot. Visitors also appreciate the stunning views, delicious food, refreshing drinks, and nightly fire shows.
name: Elephant Beach Club
address: 159 moo2, Bo Put, Amphoe Ko Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: Lookout deck with a bar, on a forested hill reached by trail or cable car, with views to the sea.
detail_description: Lamai Viewpoint & Valentine Stone is a must-visit spot in Koh Samui, Thailand. Nestled on a forested hill, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the sea and the surrounding natural beauty. You can reach this picturesque location by either hiking along a trail or taking a cable car ride to the top. Once there, you can enjoy refreshing drinks at the lookout deck with a bar while soaking in the stunning scenery.
name: Lamai Viewpoint & Heart Stone
address: 127, 199, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

excerpt: Live crocodile & cobra shows are popular at this attraction also offering monkeys & concessions.
detail_description: Located in Bophut, Samui Crocodile Farm is an intriguing attraction where visitors can learn about Thailand's diverse wildlife. The farm spans 8,000sqm and houses a variety of creatures including Siamese crocodiles, caimans, saltwater crocodiles, snakes, lizards, and monkeys. It offers live shows featuring crocodiles and snakes three times a day.
name: Samui Crocodile Farm
address: 30, 24, Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: The Villager Fishermans Village is a lively night market that takes place every Friday evening in Bophut, Koh Samui. The beachside shopping street comes to life with a carnival-like atmosphere as vendors set up along the charming stretch, offering a variety of goods including fabrics, jewelry, and herbs. This area was once home to a thriving fishing community and has now transformed into a bustling open-air market.
name: The Villager Fisherman's Village
address: Thanon Laan Thong, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Bang Rak Beach, also known as Big Buddha Beach, is not the ideal spot for swimming due to its cloudy water and limited comfortable entry points. However, the central area near the piers provides a suitable swimming environment even during low tide. The beach is home to the famous Big Buddha Temple and offers various accommodation options including hotels with private villas and resorts with common facilities like pools and air conditioning.
name: Bang Rak Beach
address: H25X+4M7, 4171, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Choengmon Beach is nestled in a gentle crescent on the northeast corner of Koh Samui, offering a diverse range of dining, drinking, and accommodation options to suit various preferences and budgets. The area is known for its upscale ambiance, with luxurious multi-star resorts dominating the backdrop. Visitors seeking pampering can indulge in the amenities offered by 5-star hotels like the White House or the Imperial Boat House without having to venture far for their needs.
name: Choengmon Beach
address: Pure Beach Club Rd, Bo Put, Amphoe Ko Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Overlap Stone, located on Koh Samui, is a popular spot for Instagram-worthy photos. To avoid long queues, it's best to visit early in the day. There is an entrance fee of 50 THB per person and 20 THB for scooter parking. The road leading to the site is steep, so cautious driving is advised. The stunning natural scenery makes it a worthwhile visit despite the small entrance fee and challenging road conditions.
name: Overlap stone
address: 438/35, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: Lamai Night Market is a vibrant and bustling market located at the northern end of Lamai beach road. It comes alive every night, but the Sunday Night Market is particularly popular. The market offers a wide range of clothing and souvenir options, different from those found in other markets on the island. Visitors can enjoy exploring four lanes filled with street food stalls serving local and international specialties, as well as an array of souvenirs.
name: Lamai Night Market ละไมไนท์มาร์เก็ต
address: 139, 2, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: Aquamaster Samui is a one-stop destination for water and land activities. From snorkeling, scuba diving, and kayaking to hiking, rock climbing, and bouldering, there's something for everyone. The experienced and passionate trainer Steve offers excellent prices on dive equipment and shares valuable tips based on his extensive diving experience around the world. The friendly and professional staff are knowledgeable about their equipment and provide thorough explanations.
name: Aquamaster Samui | Scuba Diving Equipment
address: Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Chaweng Noi Restaurant is a hidden gem located at the southern tip of Chaweng Beach, which is renowned for being the largest and most popular beach on Koh Samui. This picturesque area, often referred to as Little Chaweng, offers a more tranquil atmosphere compared to its bustling counterparts. The beach stretches approximately 7 km and is adorned with swaying coconut trees, providing an idyllic backdrop for relaxation.
name: Chaweng Noi Restaurant
address: G353+G4F, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: Terracotta-hued Buddhist temple richly decorated with sculptures of sea monsters & warriors.
detail_description: Wat Ratchathammaram Red Temple, also known as Wat Sila Ngu, is a stunning Buddhist temple located in the south of Koh Samui. The terracotta-hued temple is adorned with intricate sculptures of sea monsters, warriors, and Hindu gods such as Ganesha and Hanuman. The ongoing construction adds to its unique charm. Visitors can admire the beautiful staircase leading to the sea and the fascinating bas-relief designs on the red-clay temple hall.
name: Wat Ratchathammaram Red Temple
address: วัดพระ​ธาตุศิลางู, ตำบล บ่อผุด Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: Lush hilltop garden flanked by waterfalls & displays of statues of the Buddha, animals & more.
detail_description: Nestled atop a mountain in the serene wilderness of Koh Samui lies the enchanting Tarnim Magic Garden, a hidden gem that beckons nature lovers and art enthusiasts alike. This lush forest park is adorned with an array of captivating sculptures, including depictions of Buddha, various animals, and mythical beings. Created by local farmer Nim Thongsuk since the 1970s, this magical landscape reflects his deep appreciation for both nature and artistry.
name: Tarnim Magic Garden
address: FXMV+5Q9, Tambon Na Mueang, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84140, Thailand

detail_description: Nestled in the stunning Khao Sok National Park, Thailand, Tan Rua Waterfall is a serene oasis hidden amidst towering limestone cliffs and lush jungle foliage. A leisurely stroll from Mae Nam Viewpoint leads to this picturesque cascade, where visitors can marvel at the water tumbling through verdant greenery. The area offers opportunities for both adventure and relaxation, with rocky terrain leading to additional sections of the falls and nearby attractions like local restaurants.
name: Tan Rua Waterfall
address: GXQR+2C5, Tambon Mae Nam, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Khun Si Waterfall is a hidden gem located near the Khun Si viewpoint over Chaweng Beach in Koh Samui. It offers a serene and less crowded environment, especially in the mornings, making it an ideal spot for visitors seeking tranquility. Nestled amidst dense jungle, this smaller waterfall provides a refreshing stop for travelers before they explore other nearby attractions. Accessible without requiring extensive hiking or walking, it's a great place to unwind and take a leisurely swim in its inviting waters.
name: Khun Si Waterfall
address: G2F7+573, Wat Thale, Thailand

detail_description: The Wharf Samui is a vibrant shopping and entertainment complex located in Bophut, Koh Samui. It offers a wide range of products and services across 120 units, ensuring a stress-free parking experience with its designated parking area. Visitors can explore an array of dining options, from Asian and European cuisines at Barracuda Restaurant to authentic Thai food at Sabeinglae.
name: The Wharf
address: เดอะวอฟสมุย (taxi, บ่อผุด Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Wat Namtok Hin Lat is a beautiful temple with a platform situated above a gentle water stream. The waterfall, located about 45 minutes away from the entrance area, offers a nice hike through the jungle. It's recommended to wear proper hiking boots and be prepared for some challenges along the way. Despite the lack of water during dry seasons, it's still worth visiting for its serene atmosphere and picturesque surroundings.
name: Wat Namtok Hin Lad
address: Moo 2, Tambon Ang Thong, Amphoe Ko Samui, Surat Thani, 84140, 84330, Thailand

detail_description: Wat Na Phra Lan is a small yet stunning Buddhist temple located near Maenam's pier. The temple offers a serene and tranquil atmosphere, making it an ideal place for meditation and relaxation. Visitors can enjoy the clean and peaceful surroundings, with the gentle sound of waves adding to the ambiance. Unlike some other touristy temples, Wat Na Phra Lan appears to cater more to the local community. The duty monk is known for being friendly, offering blessings with lustral water in a separate Sala.
name: Wat Na Phra Lan
address: HXJM+VJ4, Tambon Mae Nam, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84330, Thailand

detail_description: The Coconut Museum, also known as Spaco Virgin Coconut Oil, is located 8 km from the city center and is a popular attraction in Koh Samui. Visitors can explore coconut farms and witness the production of unadulterated virgin coconut oil using around 900 coconuts daily. The museum showcases various products made from different parts of the coconut, including cosmetics and edible ingredients. Additionally, the museum offers workshops for visitors to learn about working with coconuts.
name: บ้านมะพร้าว Coconut Museum / Samui Renong Co., Ltd. / Spaco Virgin Coconut Oil
address: GWGW+6FH, Tambon Ang Thong, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84140, Thailand

detail_description: Koh Samui, located in the Gulf of Thailand, offers more than just beautiful beaches. One hidden gem is the Fisherman's Village in Bophut, featuring historic buildings, boutique shops, and trendy restaurants. Additionally, the opening of Ritz-Carlton Koh Samui has brought five-star dining options to the area. The city center provides easy access to Bophut via taxi or minibus for a range of prices.
name: Koh Samui
address: Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Elephant Rock, despite not resembling an elephant, is named for its massive size. Located between Chaweng and Lamai Beach, this peaceful area offers a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle. Hiking around the rock provides plenty of opportunities to explore, with a rewarding summit boasting breathtaking views of the Gulf of Thailand. Accessible from both Chaweng and Lamai, Elephant Rock is a must-visit for travelers seeking natural beauty and tranquility.
name: Elephant Rock
address: Mu 4 Koh- Suratthani, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Koh Samui Shooting Range is a thrilling activity option on the island, offering visitors a break from the usual beach and nature tours. The range provides an exhilarating experience with various guns to choose from and reasonable prices for 10 rounds per gun. Additionally, for a small additional fee, visitors can use their own phones to capture pictures and videos of their experience. It's considered well worth the money compared to other activities on the island, providing an exciting and memorable time in Thailand.
name: Koh Samui Shooting Range
address: G2QQ+HQM, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Ao Thong Takhian, also known as Silver Beach, is a small and secluded beach on Koh Samui. It boasts crystal-clear waters and is perfect for those seeking privacy and tranquility. Visitors can enjoy the natural beauty of the area and indulge in delicious food and drinks available at an open bar nearby. The beach is praised for its cleanliness, with nice rooms available at a great price for those looking to stay longer.
name: Ao Thong Takhian / Silver Beach / Thongtakian Beach
address: F3H8+2QG, Koh Samui, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Chaweng Beach Rd, located near the mall, is a prime destination for all your beach vacation needs in Koh Samui. It offers a wide range of beach gear, making it convenient for visitors to find everything they need in one place. Additionally, neighboring towns like Lamai and Bophut also boast unique and rare finds for those looking to explore beyond Chaweng Beach Rd.
name: Chaweng Beach Rd
address: Tambon Bo Put, Amphoe Ko Samui, Chang Wat Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

excerpt: Zoo & aquarium with Bengal tigers & leopards, also offering bird & sea lion shows.
detail_description: Samui Aquarium & Tiger Zoo is a small but charming zoo and aquarium that offers exciting shows featuring Bengal tigers, leopards, birds, and sea lions. Visitors can enjoy interacting with the animals and take pictures with the tigers and parrots for an additional fee. The friendly staff creates a welcoming atmosphere for guests to explore the diverse wildlife on display.
name: Samui Aquarium & Tiger Zoo
address: 33, 2 Laem-Set Rd, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

detail_description: Thongson Bay Beach is a stunning destination on Koh Samui, offering a relaxing vacation experience. While the location may be a bit remote, it's perfect for those seeking tranquility. The beach is known for its beauty and provides an ideal setting for a peaceful getaway. Visitors can enjoy the picturesque surroundings and the attentive service of the staff.
name: Thongson Bay Beach
address: Bo Put, Surat Thani, Thailand

detail_description: Elephant Beach Club & Resort Samui offers a total of twenty-six charming bungalows, each featuring balconies, and a stunning Villa perfect for honeymooners. The resort's beach club is known for its delicious menu items and generous portion sizes. Guests can enjoy fresh and tasty dishes such as glass noodles with seafood salad and bruschetta 3 ways while taking in the 5-star service, ocean view, and facilities.
name: Elephant Beach Club & Resort Samui
address: Elephant Beach Club & Resort 159, Beach, Chaweng Beach Rd, Tambon Bo Put, Koh Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Phetchbuncha Boxing Stadium is a popular venue in Thailand known for showcasing Muay Thai fights. It offers reasonably priced tickets and affordable drinks, making it a great option for an entertaining night out. Whether you're a fan of martial arts or simply curious about Muay Thai, this stadium provides an authentic experience. Visitors have been pleasantly surprised by the real and intense fights, as well as the friendly staff.
name: Phetchbuncha Boxing Stadium
address: G3C4+XF3, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

detail_description: Mary Help of Christians Church is a Catholic church located in Koh Samui that conducts mass in English. The church has a minimalist style and is well-maintained. A lively Philippine choir performs during the Sunday mass, which starts at 10:30 am. The community is growing, and drinks and snacks are served after the service. Additionally, the new church building is under construction with plans to open on May 24th for grand opening celebration.
name: Mary help of Christians Catholic Church
address: G2HV+FRX, เกาะสมุย, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand
